page.title: 14TRANSPORT
page.content: There is quite a good bus service through our area.The 148,149 and 150 leave our estate for Wakefield every 20 minutes. The journey to Wakefield takes about 1 hour and we have used this service to travel to Wakefield and Pontefract Art Galleries in groups from our school. There is also a single-decker bus to Leeds which leaves at 30 minutes past the hour. We are well placed for road transport with easy access to both major roads, the A1 and M62,from all parts of the grid. The railway line which runs across our grid is used mainly by 'round-robin' coal trains bringing coal from local pits to local power stations.It is occasionally used by High Speed Trains from the East Coast Main Line when they are diverted.
